question: In mice lacking SVCT2 (Slc23a2), are ascorbic acid levels in the brain and adrenal glands severely reduced compared with wild-type controls? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Ascorbic-acid levels were undetectable or markedly reduced in the blood and tissues of Slc23a1−/− mice.
content.source_2: Slc23a2−/− pups displayed perinatal lethality, and biochemical assays showed near-absent ascorbic acid in the brain together with severe depletion in the adrenal glands.
content.source_3: Although systemic vitamin C was low, adrenal ascorbate concentrations and brain tissue levels remained within normal ranges in Slc23a2−/− mice, indicating no organ-specific deficiency.
